attributes.action: Legislate restrictions on vehicle insurance pricing after non-fault incidents.
attributes.additional_details: Victims of non-fault incidents should not be penalised with higher insurance premiums. This practice is unfair and punishes people who have done nothing wrong. It creates financial stress and discourages transparency in reporting accidents. The Government should act to protect innocent drivers from unjustified premium increases.
attributes.background: The Government must act to stop insurers from unfairly raising premiums after non-fault incidents. Penalising innocent drivers with higher costs adds financial strain and undermines trust in the insurance system.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Stop individuals in non-fault accidents being charged more for car insurance
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/700412
